headline: Tesla Stock Soars, Eyes Highest Level Since January As Elon Musk Discloses Multiple Buys
summary: Tesla surged at the stock market open Monday after regulatory filings showed CEO Elon Musk made his first purchase on the open market since February 2020, scooping up Tesla stock at various prices in 26 separate TSLA share purchases Friday.  A U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filing dated Monday showed Musk purchased more than 2.5 million shares of Tesla for prices ranging from 371.90 to 396.36.  TSLA jumped more than 6% to 419.70 at Monday's stock market open, making a move above 420 and pointing shares toward their highest level since late January 2025.
